com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream

Class BufferPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream.BufferPool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Allocator

    public final class BufferPool
extends java.lang.Object
implements Allocator
    An Allocator that maintains a pool of fixed length byte arrays (buffers).

    An Allocation obtained from a BufferPool consists of the whole number of these buffers. When an Allocation is released, the underlying buffers are returned to the pool for re-use.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int bufferLength
      The length in bytes of each individual buffer in the pool.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferPool(int bufferLength)
      Constructs an empty pool.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Allocation allocate(int size)
      Obtains an allocation of at least the specified size.
      int getAllocatedSize()
      Returns the number of bytes currently allocated in the form of Allocations.
      void trim(int targetSize)
      Hints to the Allocator that it should make a best effort to release any memory that it has allocated for the purpose of backing Allocations, beyond the specified target number of bytes.
